content: Former Home and Away star Tammin Sursok says she'd love to appear on the long-running soap again.

The 39-year-old actress, who portrayed Dani Sutherland on the show from 2000 to 2004, said she would happily return for a cameo part.'I always would have said I would never have come back to Neighbours or a soap at all, but I thought it was really cool and like nostalgia for me,' she told Yahoo Lifestyle on Wednesday.'[I would return] for a week, sure, why not?' she declared. 'I would probably give a nostalgic nod to Home and Away for sure.' However, fans may be disappointed to hear that Tammin's not looking for a permanent role.

'I would never do it long term just because the hours are so gruelling, and I just wouldn't spend time with my kids,' she added.It's been more than two decades since Tammin first appeared on Home and Away, yet she still remains in contact with some of her former co-stars.The star told the publication that she was actually slated to reunite with Bec Cartwright, who portrayed Hayley Smith, in a recent film but it never happened.Tammin also maintains a friendly relationship with Chris Hemsworth, arguably one of the most successful stars to emerge from Home and Away, as well as his brothers.
Despite his ever-growing career, Tammin asserts that the Thor actor remains a 'lovely' individual.

Since Tammin moved abroad she has found success on a number of US shows.The actress portrayed Colleen Carlton on The Young and The Restless between 2007 and 2009. She also famously portrayed Jenna Marshall on Pretty Little Liars. The actress has called Los Angeles home for the past decade.
